content.full_text:
Timothy P. Andrews to Abraham Lincoln, 25 April 18491 Your letter of the 13thApril inst. making enquiries as to the claim for 3 months extra pay due Jno. J. Miller

Private K Company 6thInfantry,2addressed to thePay Master Generalhas been refered to me. In reply I state that the claim was paid to you, in person, at my office,^in cash,^on the 20thof January last; & your receipt annexed to the claim accordingly.
paragraphs: Timothy P. Andrews to Abraham Lincoln, 25 April 18491 Your letter of the 13thApril inst. making enquiries as to the claim for 3 months extra pay due Jno. J. Miller

Private K Company 6thInfantry,2addressed to thePay Master Generalhas been refered to me. In reply I state that the claim was paid to you, in person, at my office,^in cash,^on the 20thof January last; & your receipt annexed to the claim accordingly.

footnotes.text: 1Timothy P. Andrews wrote and signed this letter.
2Abraham Lincolnâ€™s letter of April 13, 1849, has not been located.John J. Miller could not be positively identified.
